BIS statistics

BIS statistics, compiled in cooperation with central banks and other national authorities, are designed to inform the analysis of monetary and financial stability, international monetary spillovers and global liquidity.

Measures international banking activity from a residence perspective, focusing on the location of the banking office
column128:
color:transparent" src="/static/images/topics/LBS_card.png"/>

Locational banking statistics

Measures international banking activity from a residence perspective, focusing on the location of the banking office
Tracks the worldwide consolidated positions of internationally active banking groups headquartered in reporting countries
column135:
color:transparent" src="/static/images/topics/CBS_card.png"/>

Consolidated banking statistics

Tracks the worldwide consolidated positions of internationally active banking groups headquartered in reporting countries
Tracks foreign currency credit in three major currencies to non-residents, ie borrowers outside the respective currency areas
column142:
color:transparent" src="/static/images/topics/GLI_card.png"/>

Global liquidity

Tracks foreign currency credit in three major currencies to non-residents, ie borrowers outside the respective currency areas
Tracks turnover in FX and OTC interest rate derivatives in the month of April in Survey years
column149:

Triennial Survey

Tracks turnover in FX and OTC interest rate derivatives in the month of April in Survey years

BIS research and innovation

This is a carousel. Use the next and previous button to navigate, or jump to a slide directly using the navigation buttons.

BIS Research

Research at the BIS supports central banks in their pursuit of monetary and financial stability.

View all

SDMX API

The BIS SDMX API web service offers programmatic access to data and metadata published on the BIS statistics.

View all

Sdmx.io

Sdmx.io is about solutions for practical official statistics use cases.

View all

SDMX/FMR

SDMX/FMR: A reference SDMX Registry implementation.

View all

IFC

The Irving Fisher Committee on Central Bank Statistics (IFC) is a forum of central bank economists and statisticians
